title: Mobile-first customer/vendor onboarding flow with vendor list and simple vendor dashboard

requirements.summary: Replace Home page with a mobile-first landing that shows two large primary actions (Customer Login, Vendor Login) and routes into each flow.
acceptanceCriteria: On mobile widths, the two actions are prominently visible without relying on the existing marketplace sections
Both actions navigate to their respective flows (Customer Login and Vendor Login) using the app router

file_operations.description: Replace existing marketplace-focused homepage content with a landing screen that uses large rounded touch-friendly action cards/buttons for "Customer Login" and "Vendor Login" and routes via the TanStack router. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button) and/or the existing PrimaryCtaButton to ensure consistent large tap targets. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Register and wire new onboarding routes so the Home page actions can navigate to the Customer Login and Vendor Login screens via the app router.

requirements.summary: Create Customer Login Form with required validation and pass selected city into the Vendor List screen on submit.
acceptanceCriteria: The City field is a dropdown limited to exactly: Kanpur, Unnao
Submitting the form without required fields shows clear English validation feedback
Successful submit navigates to the Vendor List page and preserves the selected city for filtering

file_operations.description: Implement the Customer Login form UI (Name, Mobile number, City dropdown, Area, Pin code) with required-field validation and clear English error messages. Use shadcn-ui form inputs (e.g., Input, Label, Select, Card, Button) for consistent styling and mobile-friendly spacing. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a route for the Customer Login screen and wire navigation to the Vendor List route on successful submit while carrying the selected city forward via router search params.

requirements.summary: Create Vendor List page that filters vendor cards by selected city and handles missing-city navigation gracefully.
acceptanceCriteria: The page displays only vendors matching the selected city
Each vendor is rendered as a rounded card with the required fields and a visible "View Shop" button
If no city is present (e.g., direct navigation), the page shows an English prompt to select a city and a way to navigate back to the Customer Login Form

file_operations.description: Implement a Vendor List screen that reads the selected city from router search params, filters a vendor dataset accordingly, and renders rounded vendor cards with Shop name, Area, Mobile number, and a "View Shop" button. Include a missing-city empty state with an English prompt and a navigation control back to the Customer Login screen. Use shadcn-ui Card/Button components for consistent mobile-first UI. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small static vendor dataset containing city, shop name, area, and mobile number to support city filtering and vendor card rendering for the onboarding Vendor List UI.
Add and wire the Vendor List route so Customer Login can navigate to it and direct navigation is supported.

requirements.summary: Implement View Shop navigation from vendor cards to a dedicated vendor shop screen that identifies the selected shop.
acceptanceCriteria: Tapping "View Shop" navigates to a dedicated screen/route and does not do nothing
The destination screen shows the selected shop identity in English (at minimum the shop name)

file_operations.description: Create a minimal vendor shop screen/route that identifies the selected vendor (at minimum shop name; also show city/area when available) based on the vendor id route param and/or search params. Use shadcn-ui Card/Typography for a clear mobile-first layout. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire each vendor card's "View Shop" button to navigate to the Vendor Shop route, passing a stable vendor identifier via route params and carrying city/area context as needed via search params.
Register the Vendor Shop route (with a vendor id param) in the router so navigation from Vendor List works.

requirements.summary: Create Vendor Login Form with required validation and carry submitted vendor login info into Outlet Details.
acceptanceCriteria: The City field is a dropdown limited to exactly: Kanpur, Unnao
Submitting the form without required fields shows clear English validation feedback
Successful submit navigates to the Outlet Details form page and preserves prior inputs for the flow

file_operations.description: Implement Vendor Login form UI (Name, Mobile, City dropdown, Area, Pin code) with required-field validation and English error messages. Use shadcn-ui inputs/selects/cards for mobile-first layout consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a small utility for storing and retrieving vendor onboarding draft data in sessionStorage (e.g., vendor login info) so the flow can carry inputs forward without exposing personal data in the URL.
Add a route for Vendor Login and wire successful submit navigation to the Outlet Details route, persisting the vendor login info for the next step.

requirements.summary: Create Outlet Details form with required validation including image upload UI and navigate to a simple Vendor Dashboard that displays submitted outlet details.
acceptanceCriteria: The form includes an image file input for Outlet photo upload and shows a preview or filename after selection
GST is optional and does not block submission when empty
On successful submit, the app navigates to the Vendor Dashboard page and displays the outlet name in English

file_operations.description: Implement the Outlet Details form UI (Outlet name, Outlet photo upload control accepting images with preview/filename, Outlet mobile, Aadhar number, GST optional) with required-field validation and English messages. Use shadcn-ui inputs/cards/buttons for consistent styling; ensure the image control is mobile-friendly. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Extend onboarding sessionStorage utilities to persist Outlet Details draft/submitted data (including a safe representation for the selected photo such as a local object URL for preview during the session) to support navigation to the dashboard.
Register and wire the Outlet Details route and ensure submit navigates to the new simple Vendor Dashboard route.

requirements.summary: Create a simple Vendor Dashboard screen (distinct from existing vendor portal dashboard) that is reachable after Outlet Details submit and shows a mobile-first summary card layout.
acceptanceCriteria: The dashboard is a distinct screen/route reachable via the Vendor onboarding flow
The dashboard renders correctly on mobile with large readable typography and rounded cards

file_operations.description: Implement a dedicated onboarding Vendor Dashboard page that reads the submitted outlet details from onboarding storage and displays a clean mobile-first summary card (at minimum: Outlet name, in English). Use shadcn-ui Card components and large readable typography. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add and wire a dedicated route for the simple onboarding Vendor Dashboard page (distinct from the existing protected /vendor dashboard).

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent modern colorful (non-blue/non-purple) theme and shared styling across the new onboarding screens with rounded cards, large buttons, and soft shadows using English text throughout.
acceptanceCriteria: All new screens share the same design language (spacing, radii, shadows, button styles)
Buttons meet mobile touch target expectations (visibly large and easy to tap)
All labels, placeholders, helper text, and messages on the new flow screens are in English

file_operations.description: Adjust global design tokens and/or add small reusable utility classes to enforce a consistent modern colorful theme across onboarding screens, ensuring the palette avoids blue/purple (e.g., coral/teal/lime), while keeping soft shadows, rounded cards, and large touch-friendly buttons consistent.
Align the new Home landing styling with the updated colorful theme (rounded cards, soft shadows, large buttons, consistent spacing) and ensure all user-facing text remains English.
Apply shared theme styling (rounded cards, soft shadows, large inputs/buttons, consistent spacing) to the Customer Login screen and ensure all text/validation messages are English.
Apply shared theme styling (rounded cards, soft shadows, large inputs/buttons, consistent spacing) to the Vendor Login screen and ensure all text/validation messages are English.
Apply shared theme styling to vendor cards and list layout (rounded cards, visible large "View Shop" buttons, soft shadows) and ensure all prompts are English.
Apply shared theme styling to the Outlet Details form (large touch targets, rounded cards, consistent spacing) and ensure all labels/helper text are English.
Apply shared theme styling to the simple Vendor Dashboard summary card layout (rounded cards, soft shadows, mobile-first typography) and ensure displayed labels are English.
